model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: Yes, it is quite scary. We could also hear the wolves howling at night, luckily we didn't come across them though. One thing to note about bears, is they just want to come and scrounge for our food, so we learned to safely pack it away and hang it up high in a tree.

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A appreciates Speaker B's involvement with the scout troop and invites them to a youth retreat.
2. Speaker B has been involved with Boy Scouts for 7-8 years, currently a Life Scout.
3. Speaker B is busy with scouts, school, work, and tennis, but willing to take vacation days for the retreat.
4. Speaker A is involved in church activities and mentioned a church retreat
5. Speaker B is a member of the boy scouts and works at a fast food place
6. Speaker B plans to earn the Eagle Scout badge for college applications.
current_dialogue: Speaker B: Yes, it is quite scary. We could also hear the wolves howling at night, luckily we didn't come across them though. One thing to note about bears, is they just want to come and scrounge for our food, so we learned to safely pack it away and hang it up high in a tree.

raw_prediction: That sounds like quite the thrilling experience! It's amazing how nature can both awe and humble us. I'm glad you were prepared and stayed safe during your camping trip. It must have been an unforgettable adventure!
